article.headline: Lamar 72, Nicholls St. 68
article.story: THIBODAUX, La. (AP) -- Lamar scored their last 14 points from the free throw line as the Cardinals edged past Nicholls State for a 72-68 overtime Southland Conference win on Thursday night. The teams, which each shot similar percentages from the floor, entered the extra period tied at 61. Lamar (12-8, 6-1) only had one field goal attempt in the extra period -- a misfired three-pointer by Kenny Dawkins. The difference in the game came at the free throw line where the Cardinals connected on 21-of-35 compared to 13-of-22 for the Colonels. Kenny Dawkins led Lamar with 20 points, while Lamar Sanders had 14. Ryan Bathie scored a game-high 22 points, including five 3-pointers, in the loss. The only other Colonel in double-figures was Anatoly Bose, who had 18 points and was one rebound shy of a double-double. It was the second straight overtime loss at home for the Colonels (6-17, 1-7), who were held to 39.3 percent (24-of-61) from the field. Lamar shot 38.9 percent (21-of-54) for the game.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
